2_1E5qiz3ku3EzkMaUSj7mSSVJGtecNTGtBj.body: In your ZeroNet bundle go to ZeroNet/data/users.json. This file stores information about your various IDs and some settings. If you just want a new name then you can delete (or back up) this file and then you will be handed a new ID the next time you need one. If you want to use multiple IDs this can also be accomplished by manipulating that file, but I don't know of any gui tool that does it and currently this is not the intended behavior.

2_16ruLucRLto6GhT1Zb3P8JVZzC48fxd9Cc.body: I would actually recommend against dual booting for two reasons. The first is that you will never be forced to learn the system, although it really is very user-friendly at this stage. The second is that you may find managing a dual boot too complex. I had a situation where Windows 7 modified something on my dual boot setup and could no longer boot the disc, although my data remained intact. Whether this was unavoidable or due to my own stupidity I'll never know, but it was then I decided I would just wipe the thing and use only Linux from then on. I am very happy to be free of Windows now.

1_14YkpjZoU1Q897PhRG4CWyg6CL6Rn4QEVf.body: To my understanding ZeroNet distributes websites like torrents, with blockchain technology only involved in registering zite names (namecoin). So no, even at this point it would totally unrealistic for everyone to download everything.

13_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb.body:
The premise of this thing makes no sense. Look at this from the FAQ.

>How does LBRY benefit content consumers? Why should I bother caring?
>Do you watch YouTube? Imagine paying a few cents to eliminate all ads.
I already have a free adblocker, not to mention ZeroNet video sites with no ads.

>Do you use BitTorrent? Imagine getting paid to seed files into the network.
I doubt this would be worth the money for most people. There are better file-hosting solutions already, and no one is going to pay to keep a rare movie up on the off chance someone else wants to see it.

>Do you shop on the iTunes Store? Imagine paying less for songs, TV episodes, and music videos and having 100% of the price directly to the creators.
I don't think anyone who does that sort of thing is here. Good luck wresting the illiterate masses from Apple and the other old media companies.
